messages.page_content:
- Topic: Special City Council Meeting on January 24, 2022
- Summary: The special meeting of the City Council was called to order by President Lora W. Johnson, and a roll call was conducted to establish a quorum.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: N/A - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The roll call confirmed the presence of five council members, constituting a quorum for the meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: City Council, Special Meeting, Quorum, Roll Call
- UID: 078a48da-4519-4de1-8085-bcd3a8412fd6

- Topic: Presentation - A Working Dialogue with Criminal Justice System Stakeholders
- Summary: The City Council held a presentation involving online speakers who engaged in a working dialogue with criminal justice system stakeholders.

- Decision/Key Actions: The presentation was held to facilitate discussions and dialogue with various stakeholders in the criminal justice system.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Motion to Suspend Rule 30
- Summary: The motion to suspend Rule 30 was introduced by King and seconded by Harris. The motion to suspend the rules passed with 7 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend Rule 30 was approved.
- UID: cce2ca53-76c1-4b0e-875b-5ee80d9e373e
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 1-24-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Conditional Use Permit for Neighborhood Commercial Establishment
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish a conditional use to permit a neighborhood commercial establishment in an HU-RM1 Historic Urban Multi-Family Residential District. It specifically pertains to Square 486, Lot 5, in the First Municipal District, bounded by Thalia Street, South Roman Street, South Prieur Street, and Martin Luther King, Jr. Boulevard. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,608
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend the rules to introduce the ordinance on first reading was successful, and the ordinance was introduced and laid over as required by law. 
- UID: a9a06770-cbe5-42b8-b4df-2b76acffaa2d
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 1-24-2022
